items.sentence: Tom and Mary are both obstinate, aren't they?
Tom and Mary are both obnoxious, aren't they?
Tom and Mary are both conceited, aren't they?
Tom and Mary are both at school, aren't they?
Tom and Mary are both ambitious, aren't they?
The only thing Tom ever gave me was this hat.
Neither Tom nor Mary has worked in Australia.
Neither Tom nor Mary has been friendly to me.
Last Monday, Tom and Mary ate lunch together.
I'd like to be able to speak French fluently.
